comments.author: Dunamisx
comments.body: People like you OP will always like to ask questions than taking actions, have you created time to even search the internet to learn about bitcoin and understand the exact year it was launch and how many years others have been on this kind of research to develop something like this but couldn't achieve the success with bitcoin achievements, it's never too late to invest if you're really set in for coming onboard, get yourself to learn bitcoin, buy and hold, this will be your tomorrow fortune to fall back at.

comments.author: CryptocurencyKing
comments.body: I believe to have seen similar thread and am wondering where all this ideas are coming from. Is there a timing in taking an investment? In whatever field one wants to pick an investment in!You can always pick an investment in whatever field whe you want to, there doesn't have to be a timing to it and I think at age 28, your pretty young and have got a lot of future ahead of you. By all means, buy some coins and see how you could secure it for a far longer term. You sure would be doing yourself some actual favour than seating on the sidelines due to age and whatever reason you could think of.

comments.author: mk4
comments.body: Let's make a pessimistic assumption that you're going to die at an age between 50-60. Do you think you would make money with bitcoin by holding for 22-32 years? If yes, buy bitcoin. If not, don't buy bitcoin. Simple.

comments.author: mamesso
comments.body: The word late will be known when you have counted backwards, as long as the doctor doesn't sentence anything to your health it's never too late to do anything. 28 years old still in the middle of age, now you can do anything to pursue your dreams, including investing in Bitcoin. Investing in bitcoin is not limited by age, regardless of age you can still have Bitcoin. You can teach heirs as an early anticipation to protect assets if something happens to you.

comments.author: Crypt0Gore
comments.body: This will be the third post that people are asking about if it's too late to invest in bitcoin or not, bitcoin bull and bear market changes every four years so even if you have five years left to live you will still make money out of your investment anyways. Seriously these questions are annoying because it shows that people like OP don't do the necessary research on Bitcoin first.

comments.author: _BlackStar
comments.body: Quote from: cryptoaddictchie on January 10, 2023, 06:21:56 AMI think you are asking a wrong question. Of course there is no age limit on investing. Even a younger one can invest in bitcoin as long as he has money or know how bitcoin works. Its not about age but the ability to invest or have knowledge on something they are interested about.There are many reasons why someone would want to invest, and one of them is as savings for old age or maybe for the next generation [children and their families]. So age shouldn't be the main reason why someone doesn't want to invest, so anyone can do it at any age now unless their health condition is no longer possible.Michael J. Saylor, he is 57 years old now and he is an entrepreneur who is known for consistently investing in bitcoin until today. So I mean, it can always be done but it also takes preparation and the important point is how to secure the assets.

comments.author: Rikafip
comments.body: 28 yo being too late to invest in bitcoin? Maybe if we lived in middle ages when life span was ~30 years, but luckily that's not the case. The things I am gonna hear on the forum...  Seriously, I would say that 28 yo is the perfect time to start investing because if you are much younger than that, you probably don't even have much extra money to invest in because it takes time to finish education and find yourself a good job that can enable you that. Don't stress yourself with that and instead seize the opportunity to acquire bitcoin at discount.

Go learn more about bitcoin and take on the investment.
